headline.main: NYC's Mayor Launches New Program to Help Quell Tide of Homelessness
headline.print_headline: NYC's Mayor Launches New Program to Help Quell Tide of Homelessness

docs.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio launched a new program on Thursday to reduce New York's rising population of people living on the streets, following criticism of his handling of the issue and days after the abrupt departure of his top advisor on homelessness...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio launched a new program on Thursday to reduce New York's rising population of people living on the streets, following criticism of his handling of the issue and days after the abrupt departure of his top advisor on homelessness.

headline.main: Patriots Quarterback Brady Leads Fan Voting for Pro Bowl
headline.print_headline: Patriots Quarterback Brady Leads Fan Voting for Pro Bowl

docs.snippet: Tom Brady accumulated plenty of new critics during the Deflategate probe, but the New England Patriots quarterback remains undeniably popular....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tom Brady accumulated plenty of new critics during the Deflategate probe, but the New England Patriots quarterback remains undeniably popular.

headline.main: Young Pennsylvania Man Arrested on Terrorism Charges
headline.print_headline: Young Pennsylvania Man Arrested on Terrorism Charges

docs.snippet: A Pennsylvania 19-year-old pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group, used Twitter to spread its propaganda and had a backpack with ammunition that suggests he might have been plotting an attack, federal authorities said Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Pennsylvania 19-year-old pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group, used Twitter to spread its propaganda and had a backpack with ammunition that suggests he might have been plotting an attack, federal authorities said Thursday.

headline.main: Arraignment Scheduled for Bergdahl Next Week in N. Carolina
headline.print_headline: Arraignment Scheduled for Bergdahl Next Week in N. Carolina

docs.snippet: U.S. Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl will be back in court next week for an appearance before a military judge in North Carolina....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Army Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl will be back in court next week for an appearance before a military judge in North Carolina.

headline.main: Chelsea Fans Could Sense Trouble Ahead in the Summer
headline.print_headline: Chelsea Fans Could Sense Trouble Ahead in the Summer

docs.snippet: 'There may be trouble ahead' was the opening line to Nat King Cole's memorable 1964 tune 'Let's Face the Music and Dance' and Chelsea fans could have been forgiven for thinking along the same lines back in the summer....
docs.lead_paragraph: 'There may be trouble ahead' was the opening line to Nat King Cole's memorable 1964 tune 'Let's Face the Music and Dance' and Chelsea fans could have been forgiven for thinking along the same lines back in the summer.

headline.main: More Money to Fight Wildfires, but No Long-Term Budget Fix
headline.print_headline: More Money to Fight Wildfires, but No Long-Term Budget Fix

docs.snippet: Budget legislation headed toward approval by Congress includes an additional $610 million for the U.S. Forest Service to fight wildfires next year but no long-term fix to how the agency, year after year, has had to borrow money from other programs...
docs.lead_paragraph: Budget legislation headed toward approval by Congress includes an additional $610 million for the U.S. Forest Service to fight wildfires next year but no long-term fix to how the agency, year after year, has had to borrow money from other programs to keep up with the ever-growing cost of fighting fires.

headline.main: Employers Applaud 'Cadillac' Tax Delay but Still Seek Repeal
headline.print_headline: Employers Applaud 'Cadillac' Tax Delay but Still Seek Repeal

docs.snippet: Congress delivered an early holiday present to employers this week when it proposed a two-year delay for a health benefits tax many would have had to pay starting in 2018. But businesses hope Santa will eventually leave something better under the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Congress delivered an early holiday present to employers this week when it proposed a two-year delay for a health benefits tax many would have had to pay starting in 2018. But businesses hope Santa will eventually leave something better under the tree.

headline.main: Jim Chanos Wishes He 'Could Borrow More' to Short SolarCity Stock
headline.print_headline: Jim Chanos Wishes He 'Could Borrow More' to Short SolarCity Stock

docs.snippet: Jim Chanos of Kynikos Associates said he is still betting on a huge decline in the shares of SolarCity Corp, which he has called a "subprime financing company," and said he wishes he could borrow more stock to short its shares....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jim Chanos of Kynikos Associates said he is still betting on a huge decline in the shares of SolarCity Corp, which he has called a "subprime financing company," and said he wishes he could borrow more stock to short its shares.

headline.main: Strained Relationship Between Baltimore Officers, Public

docs.snippet: Both sides at the trial of Officer William Porter cast light on a tattered relationship between law enforcement in Baltimore and its citizens. The city's history is rife with allegations, investigations and lawsuits over how people are treated on ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Both sides at the trial of Officer William Porter cast light on a tattered relationship between law enforcement in Baltimore and its citizens. headline.main: Wendy's Names CFO Penegor President, Starting CEO Succession Plan
headline.print_headline: Wendy's Names CFO Penegor President, Starting CEO Succession Plan

docs.snippet: U.S. burger chain operator Wendy's Co said Chief Financial Officer Todd Penegor would take on the additional role of president, starting the process for him to replace Emil Brolick as chief executive in May....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. burger chain operator Wendy's Co said Chief Financial Officer Todd Penegor would take on the additional role of president, starting the process for him to replace Emil Brolick as chief executive in May.
